bibl.title: Letter from Robert Carter to William Dawkins, September 5, 1729

div1.p: Robert Carter writes to London merchant William Dawkins, September 5, 1729, to notify him of a bill of exchange drawn by himself and Mann Page in favor of George Nicholas.

div1.head: Letter from Robert Carter to William Dawkins, September 5, 1729

opener.dateline:
Rappa[hannock, Lancaster County, Virginia]
Sept. 5th. 1729
Mr Wm. Dawkins

div1.p:
This is only a line of Advice to let you know
Colo Page and I have this day drawn upon you for the sum
of fifty one pounds two shillings & Eleven pence payable to Doctor
George Nicholas being money due to him from Mr Burwells
Estate and to be paid upon the Accot of the Estate I am

div1.head: NOTES
div1.note: Source copy consulted: Letter book, 1728 August-1731 July, Robert Carter Papers (acc. no. 3807), Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia.

Robert Carter generally used a return address of "Rappahannock" for the river on which he lived rather than "Corotoman," the name of his home, on his correspondence, especially to merchants abroad. The county and colony have been added for clarity.
